gt_summary: Use an oral rehydration solution. Avoid other fluids. Breastfeed an infant. Maintain hydration. Check the child’s urine.
pred_summary: The recommended treatment for mild to moderate dehydration in children is to use a commercial electrolyte solution such as Pedialyte, given at a rate of 1-2 teaspoons every few minutes. The goal is to restore the child's fluid levels over the course of 3-4 hours, and to continue providing fluids for the next 24 hours to ensure proper rehydration. The color of the child's urine is a good indicator of whether the treatment is working, with pale, clear yellow urine indicating proper rehydration.

Next, fold a strip of chiyogami paper to create the collar of the doll and attach it to the body. Finally, cut a strip of chiyogami paper to create the obi and attach it to the front of the kimono.

gt_summary: Think through your decisions so you don’t act impulsively. Work on controlling your anger or frustration so you don’t act out. Take responsibility for your actions if you make a mistake. gt_summary: Learn what soldering is. Use solder to bind things. Use a soldering iron to heat the solder. Use other equipment to assist in soldering. Turn on the lights. Prepare adequate ventilation. Don't solder for too long in one sitting.
pred_summary: Soldering is the process of joining two or more metal components together by melting a softer metal, called solder, between them. Soldering differs from welding in that the softer metal is used to connect the components, rather than melting them together. Soldering is commonly used in electronics work, plumbing, and other applications where a strong bond is needed between metal components.

gt_summary: Choose a leg and gently pull it out. Secure one of his/her nails. Pick up the nail clippers with your other hand. Identify the quick in the nail. Trim the nail.
